Hello!

My name is Yulia and I am a certified psychologist. For 12 years I have been working with people and dealing with a wide range of difficulties that can arise in relationships with people. I also consider the difficulties in understanding myself, my self-awareness and worldview. In my work, I devote a lot of time to working with fears, basic attitudes, behavioral patterns, beliefs, as well as intrinsic motivation and goals. Client focus is an important aspect in my practice.

Through my practice, I have found that most of the difficulties we face now have their roots in childhood, which is obviously not a secret for you. Therefore, the resolution of current difficulties is in remembering, living and analyzing the moments when they first arose. Causal relationships permeate our life in everything and what we are now is the result of the events that happened to us, the emotions and sensations that we experienced and the conclusions that we made on the basis of the above. Becoming aware of and recognizing our own feelings and emotions is key in releasing old trauma, emotion, and energy. Everything that happened to us throughout life is neatly stored in our memory. All unconscious, not accepted and not expressed emotions, remain in the unconscious. Our psyche is an incredible substance that can create amazing things to protect its safety in an adequate state. Difficult situations that we face generate our emotions and reactions and sometimes remain like clamps in the body when we cannot cope with them. Clamps are places in the body that are constantly in unconscious tension. Releasing memories, emotions associated with them, and understanding the conclusions that we have made relieves tension in the body and makes it possible to reconsider what we think, how we do it and whether or not we believe in it.

The main areas of my work are looking at relationships with the father, the mother and the self. The relationship with the dad determines our relationship with all male people, since the father is the first example and experience of interaction with people of this gender. The nature of the relationship with dad also affects our sense of security in the world / in life, the degree of orientation in the material world and the ability to express ourselves in activities and realize ourselves as a person. Relationship with mom defines our relationship with all female people, the first example and experience of interaction with people of this gender, as well as our ability to recognize, understand, accept and express emotions and feelings. Our relationship with mom is about feeling accepted, understood, loved.

Unconditional love that comes from parents to us is often unseen by the conventions of adequate behavior, which they are trying to teach us in accordance with social norms and subjective understandings. The value system often becomes imposed and does not resonate with us. In this regard, I take the time to review existing beliefs, recognize the true ones and discard those that are no longer relevant. This work allows you to restructure the behavior and attitude to many things.

As a rule, the main spectrum of difficulties is associated with relationships with parents and, as a result, with partners. In working with them, we naturally recognize ourselves and get rid of the unnecessary. After bringing these aspects into a healthy state, you can move on to finding your own business, self-realization and motivation. We will touch on these issues as we resolve difficulties with parents, but a sense of our potential, our own integrity and fulfillment often comes when we are alright in the first two aspects.

Steps

The first step in my practice is to find out where we are. This step shows how you feel, what is happening or has happened, and what you want to change. Change is something that always happens in my practice. You will change and your life and environment will follow you. Therefore, before you start, ask yourself: "Do I want changes? Am I ready to work in this direction?"
A psychologist is not a magic pill that you can take and get results without doing anything. A psychologist is a person who knows what to do and how to get where you want to go. This is the person who knows what a healthy situation looks like and what needs to be done to get into it. In my work, I often use visualizations. In my opinion, this is a very simple and effective method to detect real emotions, experiences and the state of affairs at the level of emotions. By visualizing something, we easily and immediately imagine what it is. We deliberately give permission for everything to take place, since this is what we represent, this is not serious, and it can be anything. In practice, however, we tell what we actually feel.

The second step is analyzing what we found in the first step and understanding what we want and setting goals. At this stage, we discuss how things are, draw parallels and cause-and-effect relationships between the pictures that we created in the course of working with visualizations and the emotions and sensations that you experience. We also identify inappropriate moments in roles with parents, false beliefs and attitudes and what does not suit you. Next, we will explore what exactly we will change and set specific goals and objectives.

The third step is the therapy itself. The main methods in my approach are talking and working with visualizations. I take a holistic approach and therefore at the end of the session I often give practices and assignments that you can use in between our meetings. I also provide online support between sessions.
In my practice, I noticed that often people need time to tune in to our work, talk about events between sessions, just exhale and stop, so instead of the usual hour, I have around two hour sessions.
